result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

12:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Anthony Prekop in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant AFSCHIN SATTAKEH in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Lim in court for AFSCHIN SATTAKEH. Agreement entered onto court record.  Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily.  Pre-Sentence Investigation waived by parties.  Victim/Witness rights complied with. Father of victim makes sentencing statement.  Judge advises parties of conflict of interest.  Defense moves court to recuse itself.  Request granted, court to recuse itself.  Noted for clarification purposes, Court accepts plea, recusal for sentencing.

8:36 AM Defendant AFSCHIN SATTAKEH in court with attorney Michael Lim.  Defendant AFSCHIN SATTAKEH in custody at the Winnebago County Jail.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AFSCHIN SATTAKEH appeared by Zoom video means with Attorney.  Information on file.  Defense acknowledges receipt of information and waives reading.  Noting a special appearance and enters a not guilty plea.  Court notes victim's rights are complied with.  Court orders bond to continue.  Parties request plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:34 AM Defendant AFSCHIN SATTAKEH in court with attorney Michael Lim.  Defendant AFSCHIN SATTAKEH in custody.  Adam Joseph Levin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AFSCHIN SATTAKEH appeared by video means with Attorney.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 11:37.  Arraignment scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2 COUNTS BAIL JUMP (REPEATER), BATTERY (DV,DV-REPEATER), DC (DV, DV-REPEATER), KNOWINGLY VIOLATE A DOMESTIC ABUSE ORDER (DV, DV-REPEATER)
CONDITIONS:   No contact with V1 or V1's residence in Oshkosh PD report #22-4098.  No possession of dangerous weapons.  No possession of firearms or facsimile firearms.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.

09:30 AM Defendant AFSCHIN SATTAKEH in court with attorney Michael Lim.  Defendant AFSCHIN SATTAKEH in custody.  Tucker T. Tellefson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AFSCHIN SATTAKEH appeared by video means with Attorney.  Set for Prelim.  Defense requests bond reduction.  The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law to address bond.  The State objects to a signature bond but wouldn't object to a $10,000 - $20,000 cash bond.  The Court will set a $15,000 cash bond with same conditions.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 9:37.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
